Synthetic Optimization Analysis SYNTHETIC

Analysis of 455 customers across 1,379 unique SPSAs reveals significant optimization opportunities. Customer segmentation shows 6 distinct market segments with varying volume profiles. Strategic scheduling adjustments for top accounts could yield SAR 153,000/year in savings through improved batch consolidation and reduced changeover frequency.

Savings Calculation Methodology

The synthetic savings estimate uses illustrative values to demonstrate what real analysis could reveal:

1.
Customer Volume Analysis

Analyzed job frequency and volume patterns for all 455 customers to identify consolidation opportunities.

2.
Changeover Cost Model

Each product changeover estimated at SAR 450 (15 minutes downtime + recalibration + quality verification).

3.
Batch Optimization

Grouping similar SPSAs from same customer reduces changeovers by estimated 340 per year.

4.
Off-Peak Scheduling

Shifting 15% of flexible orders to off-peak hours reduces energy cost by SAR 0.12/kWh.

Real Calculation Formula:

Annual Savings = (Changeover Reduction x SAR 450) + (Off-Peak kWh x SAR 0.12)

Data Required for Real Calculations:

  • Actual changeover time measurements per SPSA transition
  • Customer delivery schedule flexibility ratings
  • Historical batch size optimization results
  • Energy rate schedules by time of day

Scheduling Optimization Opportunities

Identified patterns for batch consolidation

Batch Similar Dose

Group products requiring similar dose ranges to minimize beam adjustments

Est. Savings * SAR 45K/yr
Dedicated Medical Days

Reserve specific days for high-dose medical device sterilization

Est. Savings * SAR 62K/yr
Priority Scheduling

Implement priority queues for time-sensitive products

Est. Savings * SAR 28K/yr
Customer Consolidation

Combine small orders from same customer into batches

Est. Savings * SAR 18K/yr

Customer & Product Mix Optimization Recommendations

Available with Current Data

  • • Implement dose-based scheduling to group similar products
  • • Create dedicated processing windows for high-volume customers
  • • Develop seasonal capacity planning for dates processing
  • • Optimize product mix to maximize throughput per shift

Data Collection Suggestions

  • • Actual revenue data - for accurate profitability analysis
  • • Customer lead times - to optimize delivery scheduling
  • • Order frequency patterns - for demand forecasting
  • • Contract terms - to understand volume commitments
